intro: Cissus neghelliensis, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, fig-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in greenhouses.
